project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h4. Symptom
In GreenHopper 5.0/5.0.1/5.1, the Burndown/Burnup/Value Charts of released versions may not display the correct value under "By Children" of the Project Overview in the Released Board.

h4. Cause
When the Context is selected in Chart Board, the Burndown/Burnup/Value Charts of Project Overview in the Released Board wrongly applies that selected Chart Board Context to calculate out the relevant values to generate chart. 

h4. Workaround
When viewing Burndown/Burnup/Value Charts under "By Children" of the Project Overview in the Released Board, instead of selecting Context in Released Board, you need to select the appropriate Context in Chart Board, then go back to Release Board, click the 'cog' icon of Project Overview panel, and click 'recompute'.
fields.summary: The Context Selecton of Chart Board may Impact Burndown/Burnup/Value Charts of "Project Overview" in Released Board

fields.description:
Old feature of issues in task view (and planning view, byt the way) was a double-click meant that issue alone expanded to be in summary (or card) form. This allowed updaets to fields in those forms directly on the task or planning view.

Now it seems that task view and planning view in list form doesn't allow this direct method of update or examination.

Please re-instate this feature.  It was a useful 'marker method' for group discussion in planning.
fields.summary: Double click on list issue (in task view) should expand to card (or summary) form

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As an administrator,
I want to be able to schedule the burndown chart to be emailed to people,
So that I can keep stakeholders informed of project progress even though they refuse to take the five seconds it would take them to login to Jira.
fields.summary: Scheduled email reports w/JIRA Software charts (Burndown in particular)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a project administrator,
I want the ability to disable the automatic print feature when I use the Print Chart feature,
So that I can more easily capture and send chart information to stakeholders.


We have stakeholders that refuse to use Jira but I need to keep them informed about our sprint progress.  I want to email the daily issue burndown to them each day but this doesn't appear to be an option.  I could easily automate this process via the 'Print Chart' feature but that page automatically tries to print the page because it has an onload event of window.print();

It would be great if I could pass in an CGI variable to disable the onload event.

Also, and this appears to be a different issue entirely, but the chart doesn't always appear to be the one I expect.  I've found that the chart appears to use my logged in defaults rather than the parameters I'm passing it.  The following is a sample url:

http://jira/secure/CCBPrintChart.jspa?decorator=none&selectedProjectId=10010&selectedBoardId=10015&chartType=gh.chart.bissueburndown&fieldId=&forMaster=false

I'm asking for the issueburndown chart but if the last thing I looked at was the hours burndown chart and then I follow that link, I'll see the hours burndown chart.  Maybe I'm doing something wrong, I don't know...
fields.summary: Optionally disable automatic 'print' feature of Print Chart

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h4. Symptom
If users added the customized column(s) in Task Board under GreenHopper 3.\*/4.\*, after upgrading GreenHopper 5.\* the issue count statistics in Version Panel of Planning Board, such as 'In Progress'/'Done' count, may not be correct. This problem is only exposed when the customized column is added at the end position of Task Board columns with the different column name.

h4. Workaround
1. If customizing template configuration globally
* Go to Administration -> GreenHopper -> Project Templates
* Select the customized template
* Click 'Reset to default configuration' link
* Recreate the all customized columns, and *have to keep the name of last column unchanged as "Done"*.
* Go to Agile -> Tools -> Configuration -> Task Board Mapping, click "Reset to default configuration" link to reset project template

2. If customizing template configuration on project base
* Go to Agile -> Tools -> Configuration -> Task Board Mapping, click "Reset to default configuration" link to reset project template
* Recreate the all customized columns, and *have to keep the name of last column unchanged as "Done"*.
fields.summary: Issue Count Statistics in Version Panel of Planning Board may not be Correct after Upgrading to GreenHopper 5.*

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If GreenHopper showed its own version in the footer, in addition to the JIRA version, it would help with reporting bugs against GreenHopper because I'd know which version was running on StAC, etc.

For example, Apache does this with some of its plugins ([see here|http://www.apache.org/fourohfour]): 

bq. Apache/2.3.7-dev (Unix) mod_ssl/2.3.7-dev OpenSSL/1.0.0a Server at www.apache.org Port 80

You can see that this Apache version is using mod_ssl version 2.3.7-dev, etc.
fields.summary: Show GreenHopper version in page footer

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
What is needed is cross project ranking of some kind. For a team with at least 6 active projects and developers working on multiple projects, each person giving different percentages of their time to each project: should there be a way to rank the importance of issues not by the priority, but by what someone have determined would be the best order in which to tackle problems. The ability in Greenhopper to use the planning board for team wide planning inside each project breaks down at the individual level.

The ultimate goal is to have a page where each user can go and look at all their issues and make sorted todo list in GreenHopper, a page on the Agile section that is designed for personal ranking. On the side would be each project and then the list of issues you are assigned in each. Dragging issues could rank in a separate ranking field, something like "personal priority" could be used for private self organization. This would make it easy to decide on what someone should spend time and not effect how things are prioritized inside of each project.

Also a simple auto prioritize can be handled by managing a slider to show percent of time currently devoted to each project. This would just weigh each project issue's importance based on the percent time that project is allotted. Then the developer could go in and reorder things to their liking.
fields.summary: Add cross project ranking (personal planning)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
in previous version these values were in hours and it was very convenient, as when we came to plan the sprint we calculated the amount of people we have, multiple it with the days of the sprint and multiple it by the time logged every day (that is not JIRA's hours count per day).
This way we got some hours estimation for the sprint - lets say 500 hours.

But now we need to start calculating how many weeks and day these 500 hours stand for. This is really not good.
It should be possible to change the perspective of these values to other units such as hours and days.
fields.summary: GreenHopper planning board - "time estimate / remaining / spent" - it should be possible to see these values in different values - e.g. hours

fields.description: Currently in hour burndown chart we show "trend line" for Burndown, and "ongoing line" for other metrics. The request is to add a switcher in burndown chart to show/hide the "trend line" for team effort / estimate accuracy / required daily burndown rate.
fields.summary: GreenHopper User Requires a Switch in BurnDown Chart to Show The Trend Line for Team Effort / Estimate Accuracy / Required Daily Burndown Rate

 # reorder the task board so that issues that are done as a whole are shown at the bottom.

Also we had to reconfigure the card and line styles to add the story points and the ranking field.

Does exporting/importing a project which has GreenHopper involve some added configurations?  Why did the release date information not get included during the import?

Thanks for the help.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi,

In the different views on the task board you have the outline :

!taskboard2.PNG|thumbnail!

However in this view it's quite confusing :

- lot of lines in light color. Visually it's looks like an excel file ;)
- the story can't be moved through the workflow
- fonts are hard to read

I prefer the kanban view but it lacks of story grouping. 

Recently I've discovered another tools (scrumers) and I like the way they propose a kanban view with the ability to group per stories :

http://bier.scrumers.com/projects/biershop/sprints/36?user_story_id=848

!taskboard3.png|thumbnail!

On this picture, on the left you can select the story and it displays the subtasks associated to this story.

It is interesting to have a list of the stories on the left ordered (and orderable) by priority (greenhopper ranking) and the list of subtasks relative to the selected story 

(it reminds me the planning board with the list of versions and the list of story relatives to this version)
fields.summary: Add another view in the task board

http://bier.scrumers.com/projects/biershop/sprints/36

(note also the color of the card with a gradient ;))

fields.description:
To reproduce:
Create version 1.0
Create version 1.1 which is a child version of 1.0
create a context different from the default
create an agile gadget for the test project

Now, in the agile gadget, select the velocity tab. All appears normal. ( Step1.png )

Go to the chart board and switch the context. Values appear normal for the context ( Step2.png)

Update the chart in the Agile gadget. Now the values display for selected context in the chart board even though the Default context remains selected in the gadget. ( Step3.png )

No matter what context one selects for the Agile gadget it will not update until you switch the corresponding chart in the chart board.

This affects JIRA 4.1.2 with GreenHopper 5.1
fields.summary: Agile gadget does not update certain charts properly when using contexts

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a product owner, I want to be able to see more stories on the planning board view so that I can once again do sprint planning with the group.
----

Previously, in list view, we could see about 26 tickets on the planning board screen, using list view.
Now we can see 13 or 14. Our group usually does more than that in a single two-week sprint, so it makes planning much more difficult. When we could see twice that number, it was easier to see the whole set of work for the next sprint, and look down the list for the next appropriate tickets of the right size we could use to fill the couple points.

In addition, we use the planning board when meeting with the PO's "advisory committee" (for lack of a better term), so we run into the same problems with that group.
I love the new look (including the handling of the ticket colors, and the cleanness of the right side), but the fact that half the content went away is a problem.

Maybe moving the board search and filter icon up to the space in the gray area would give you room for one more result at least, and squishing the bars for each ticket a bit, so the there is less padding above and below the issue type icon?
fields.summary: More stories visible in "list view" of planning board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I need to send a link to my team of the task board I'm looking at (see screenshot) with the context, version and "All Assignees" selected. There doesn't appear to be an obvious link in the UI that I can copy and paste.

My browser URL won't maintain the state because it is just: https://studio.atlassian.com/secure/TaskBoard.jspa

Ideally the browser URL would always be a permalink (using some kind of anchor or something to set the state), but if not, you need a link somewhere on the screen that is obvious or labelled "Permalink".
fields.summary: Permalink for task board configurations

fields.description:
On 13 July 2010 04:31, Christina Bang <cbang@atlassian.com> wrote:

    Just forwarding along a suggestion from a user to add to the GreenHopper installation docs.

    ---------- Forwarded message ----------
    From: Christina Bang <sales@atlassian.com>
    Date: Mon, Jul 12, 2010 at 11:24 AM
    Subject: RE: Response to your missed Atlassian Chat [sra.com]
    To: Jim_Stafford@sra.com


    Hi Jim,

    Sorry, I missed this email when I replied a few moments ago.  Thanks, I'll pass this along to the documentation team.

    Thanks,

    Christina Bang
    Sales Engineer - Atlassian
    San Francisco - California USA
    sales@atlassian.com - 415 701 1110

    Watch all the presentations from this year's Atlassian Summit
    Good to go.
     
    Found the server log that had the startup error information about the plugin. My .jar file was corrupted, I re-downloaded, and now see the menu.
     
    Suggest adding a "what if you don't see the GreenHopper menu" to your setup instructions.
       a) verify the .jar file is good (size, can jar tf process it)
       b) check the server stdout log for more details
     
    thanks,
    jim

    From: Stafford, Jim
    Sent: Mon 7/12/2010 11:45 AM
    To: Eric Snyder
    Subject: RE: Response to your missed Atlassian Chat

    Still not getting it...
     
    I am following the detailed instructions provided on the web site, however I am not locating the GreenHopper section of the administration page menu.
     
    "Select 'License Details' from the 'GreenHopper' section of the administration menu. "
     
    I have the following installed:
    /cygdrive/c/Program Files/Atlassian
    $ ls Application\ Data/JIRA/plugins/installed-plugins/
     
    jira-greenhopper-plugin-5.0.1.jar
     
    $ ls JIRA\ 4.1.2/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/jira*                                      
    ls: cannot access JIRA 4.1.2/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/jira*: No such file or directory
     
    I have restarted Jira and have also tried rebooting the machine.
       * how can I tell if the plugin is being seen?
       * where, specifically is the GreenHopper section of the Admin menu?
     
    thanks,
    jim
     
     

    From: Eric Snyder [mailto:sales@atlassian.com]
    Sent: Mon 7/12/2010 8:07 AM
    To: Stafford, Jim
    Subject: Response to your missed Atlassian Chat

    Hi Jim,

    Sorry we missed you on Live Chat.

    JIRA and GreenHopper licenses are separate, there is no bundled JIRA/GreenHopper download evaluation license. I have added a GreenHopper evaluation license to your account [UN: jim_stafford@sra.com ]. Here are the GreenHopper install instructions:

    http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+Installation+and+Upgrade+Guide#GreenHopperInstallationandUpgradeGuide-install

    Cheers,
    Eric Snyder

    --

    +31 20 796 0060 (Amsterdam, Netherlands)

    Time: 12:29:36 PM

    Web Site: Technical Sales

    My newupcoming project has Jira and Greehopper purchased and installed and does not seem to be leveraging it completely for an Agile process. I wanted to play with a test instance and attempted to download Jira Greenhopper just to experiment over the weekend. After the 30 trial install, I could not locate Greenhopper in my instance. Can I try Greenhopper for play locally?

As the Ranking field is used internally by GreenHopper and is managed automatically it shouldn't be edited anyway, but there ought to be a warning of some sort to this effect, rather than the user attempting to edit the field then getting a stack trace.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The List view (standard not compact as in Task Board) will show all the fields as configured if the browser size is large enough. As the available space decreases, to protect the ability to view and edit fields, some fields will not be shown.
The priority for the fields is as follows:
The issue-key (with priority + type icons and any parent/sub keys)
An issue flag icon or released icon (if present)
The corner field (if present)
Then from left to right as selected in the configuration screen.

In List view I hiding the Statistics column when not needed will increase the space available.
fields.summary: Document List view issue field visibility

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The Task Board in List view has some design characteristics to optimise the issue when space is limited.
Depending on the combination of browser size and column count the corner-field and/or the issue flag/issue released will be hidden. This is done when the issue is too small to allow them to be shown and the issue key and issue summary to be legible and the issue summary to be editable.

This is from version 5.0 onwards, before this the List issue view did not allow inline-editing.

To view the fields if they are hidden solutions would be:
1. Make the browser window wider if possible
2. Hide one or more columns, using the cog actions in the column, until the fields become visible.
fields.summary: Document Task Board Corner & Flag/Released field visibility

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The Flag does not appear in Task Board for List view only if Greenhopper 5.0.1 is installed. Using Greenhopper 4.4.1 does not caused this problem.

Here are the step to replicate this problem:
# flag an issue
# view issue in Planning Board in Summaries and List (the flag appear for the issue)
# view issue in Task Board in Summaries view > the flag will appear
# view issue in Task Board but in List view > the flag is not there

This does not happen if using Greenhopper 4.4.1 and JIRA 4.1.1.
fields.summary: Flag did not appear in Task Bord for List view in FireFox 3.6.6, IE7/8

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: let's make issue type labels more i18n???
fields.summary: Planning Board i18n

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It seems to me as the defenition to collect issues not done, is not working the way as stated on this site:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Configuring+your+Task+Board+Settings
On this page, it is said that the defenition of done, is the mapped value on the right-most column. 

If an issue has a unmapped value, the issue is also regarded as done. This creates some problem for our column mapping, where we have some unmapped columns where the issue still is not considered done. I would preffer not to create columns like 'estimated' and 'draft', which are status' we use in the workflows.
fields.summary: Release definition of done, does not reflect column definition of done

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: As a GH user, I would like to have an option to filter on the board search to limit results (specifically unresolved or not done items) so we can work the backlog on projects with many issues.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
From the Agile view, when an issue is clicked and its details are shown in a window that opens on top of the browser window, there is no way to change the size of the issue details windows. This was possible in GreenHopper 3.x and would be nice to have still, because the opened windows is not very big.

Would it be possible to add a resize button in a future release of GreenHopper?
fields.summary: Resizable issue details window in GreenHopper

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: In Planning/Task Board, when a project has the many versions, e.g. 30 ones, the version dropdown box will be extended out of browser range, then user has to scroll the whole page to achieve the bottom of version list, it's not so convenient. Customer requires to restrict the length of version dropdown box and show a vertical scroll bar for it (rather than the whole web page) when getting too many versions to be handled by the defined length of dropdown box.
fields.summary: Version Dropdown Box should have a vertical Scroll Bar

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: I would like to be able to sort by priority, then by rank. So a secondary (or more) field to sort by would be nice. Being able to still rank in the planning board would be nice too, but I can see how it might be problematic.
fields.summary: Secondary Sort for Greenhopper Contexts

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Right now if a subtask has a higher rank then the parent, it will show up elsewhere, and appear to be a subtask to another ticket, without looking close enough.

Sometimes you want to see the children to show up with the parent no matter the rank differences, and keep the current behavior of when changing a rank of a subtask to be against other subtasks.

I can see the need to have both behaviors, where the subtasks show up in the global rank list, and also where it is based off parent tasks first, then subtasks as a secondary sort on rank.
fields.summary: Ranking in Planning Board with subtasks

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When we are running Scrum stand-ups, often the issue type isn't of major relevance to us.

What's really important is seeing who is doing what.

At the moment we create a context for each user, with a filter on their name, and switch between contexts to see their cards.  This is not terrible, but then you can only see one user at a time.

What would be great is seeing everyone is the default context, but choosing a View option to "Colour by Assignee"  (maybe can just automatically choose a random color to associate with each person).
fields.summary: As a GH User, I'd like to view Task Board card colours by Assignee

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Jira natively supports multiple versions on a ticket however the Greenhopper Planning Board does not. This is a real issue for us as greenhopper reuses the jira version field for sprints.

Essentially we maintain several versions of our products, and in one sprint we may be doing bugfixes/features on a couple different product versions. Thus nesting sprints under versions is not a good solution for us.

eg in one sprint we want to do feature development on version 2.0 and a couple bug fixes on version 1.1 of our product. The version 'Sprint x' cannot be a child of either of the two product versions. We are then forced to have sprint versions on the same level as product versions. This means in order to actually have the correct product version assigned to an issue, the developer has to manually edit the issue and add the version to it. 
However, moving an issue between versions/sprints in the Greenhopper Planning board will result in resetting all previous versions manually set on an issue, so despite manually editing the ticket versions, the version can quickly and easily be lost.

A couple solutions we can think of are to:
1. We feel that the core of the issue comes from Greenhopper re-purposing Jira's version field. So the solution here is to have Greenhopper not to use the jira version field for sprints. This seems the most sensible option (for us), but will obviously require a fair change in greenhopper.
2. Allow CTRL + dragging in the planning board to ADD a version to an issue instead of replace the version. This would allow us to move all the issues we want to fix in version 2.0 to that version. Then when doing a sprint we would CTRL + drag the issue to the specific sprint. This would allow the issue to retain its original product version when adding it to a sprint on the same level as the product version. However, as this is an extra step, it could easily be forgotten, leaving us with the occasional bug with incorrect versioning. 
3. Set up another custom field in Jira to store the actual product version in. Then the Jira Version field can be used entirely for greenhopper sprints (kindof backwards I know). Developers will have to manually edit issues and set the new 'Really fixed in Version' field. Doing it this way we also loose other Jira functionality such as the roadmap and release notes features...
4 other solutions welcome....?

We have a growing installation of Atlassian products company wide and this is the single biggest issue we have with being able to find a usable workflow.
fields.summary: Multiple version support in Greenhopper

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The functionality to do just this for versions during planning sessions is extremely useful and has eased our workflow considerably (in contrast to the way this is handled in JIRA 4 even). While this might be needed less frequent for components depending on your workflow, the benefits would be equally substantial during the initial setup phase of a project at least - think of it this way:
* During the initial story triage of a project the team develops an overall project concept and plan - versions are definitely most important regarding release planning, but components are equally essential for providing context, splitting responsibility, assembling sub teams and the like.

Besides, components and versions are mostly handled symmetrically elsewhere in GH, which seems to match almost all workflows I've been involved with so far at least.
fields.summary: As a GH user, I would like to add new components to a project directly from the planning board so that I don't need to leave GH for this frequent task.

fields.description:
Hi,

If you are using JIRA 4.1.1 and Greenhopper 5.0.1, and go Administration Tab >> Greenhopper >> Enable Projects, if you have any project which its name have brackets ( '{' and '}' ), the page errors out. Seems simple to reproduce, and simple to fix.

Also, I have tested this with JIRA 4.1.1 and Greenhopper 4.4.1, and with this setup it works just fine.

Cheers

Thiago Prisco
Atlassian Support

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If i'm watching the planning-board there are some statistics on the right site.

If i'm clicking on a bar (view screen: filterlink.jpg) the "SearchIssue" window appears with an JQL-error.

The error said that there is no field named "Vorgangstyp".
"Vorgangstyp" is the translated word for issuetype.

So my first idea was that JQL cant take the default language, where Vorgangstyp is the same like issuetype, so i switched my profile language to english and clicked the same bar with the same filter.

Another JQL error appears whith "no field like "issue type".
True. It's not "issue type", its "issuetype" without that space.


So where is the error now and how to solve that problem?
fields.summary: Wrong Filter from PlanningBoard to JQL

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
See the ['Listeners' section under 'Administration'|http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/admin/jira/ViewListeners!default.jspa]: both are spelled as 'Synchornizer' rather than 'Synchronizer' there.

This is obviously trivial, but since it shows up in logs (see e.g. JRA-19466 and JRA-20146) it affects searching for related issues.
fields.summary: The version and component synchronizer listeners do both have a typo in the administration user interface.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The release date shown on the days remaining gadget is confusing.  If, on the burn down chart, you have selected an end date, then it shows that date, otherwise, it shows the release date of that version.  The things that are confusing here:

* When you select an end date for the burn down chart, it feels like you are just setting something for viewing chart, not a persistent property of the version or project that would effect anything else.  So it comes as a complete surprise that setting this value would have any effect on the days remaining gadget.
* The days remaining gadget uses the terminology "release", for example "Next release due", and when you select to view the master version, it also shows "Release date".  Hence, the logical assumption is that the dates shown here are release date of the version, not the end date for the burn down chart.
* There is nowhere else, other than on the burn down chart, that lists the end date, so the user is left guessing as to why the date shown on the days remaining gadget is different to the release date.  Maybe adding the end date to the planning board version view, so the user can see that there are in fact two different dates configured, would help.
fields.summary: Days remaining gadget release date is confusing

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Do not use more height than is necessary to display all fields (of any issue type for uniformity) plus the bottom right field.
fields.summary: Minimise blank space within the Card and Summary view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH044/Ranking+Issues+in+GreenHopper#RankingIssuesinGreenHopper
fields.summary: Documentation of the GreenHopper 4.4 release is giving the impression that the "Rank in Page" is available - which is not prior to 5.0

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Is some departments we use the flagging feature to emphasise urgent which cannot wait to be prioritized  before next planning meeting. Together with context, this gives the unplanned/planned issues velocity as well. 

But then we need to use other ways to track impeded tasks (status or priority field). But I like the way the flagging field highlights the issue on Planning Board and Task Board. 

Of course, everything of this can be solved, but it is not very neat and intuitive. I don't like to use the status for impediment, becuse it is not really a workflow status (You would need to be able to reach impeded from all status etc.). Priority is a bit lost after GH introduction, since ranking is the real priority. Priority has kinda become severity, even though you cannot change the name.

Would you consider to improve the it feature to support multiple values, maybe even combined with multiple colored flag marker?
fields.summary: As a reporter, I would like to be able to flag an issue with multiple types of flag

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Users get frustrated trying to find an issue only to later realise that a filter is on and that had it been turned off they could have found their issue quickly.

While this is partially a training issue, it could be fixed easily if the filter icon were to turn red or green if a filter is on/in affect, blank/white when no filter is on.
fields.summary: Filter icon to change if a filter is on

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When cards, summaries and lists when a field is to be displayed such as Version, assignee, etc. that is empty, nothing displays.  This causes some confusion as it is unknown to the user if something hasn't been selected, or is just not available for that issue type.

A simple, none, NA, or a dash character where the field should appear would end any confusion and make it clearer than nothing has been selected
fields.summary: Blank fields to show "None" or "NA" or a dash

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
On the planning and task boards when a sub-task is displayed, the parent ID# is shown.  This is handy, however if the sub-task has been dragged somewhere away from the parent the quick visual linking is lost for the user.  

Because the user creating the sub-task typically assumes knowledge of the parent for all future users, the user viewing only the sub-task needs a quick way to know what the sub-task belongs to.

If the mouseover of the parent ID were to display the parent task's Summary, this would help the user understand how the sub-task fits into the bigger picture without having to open the parent or the child in the Jira view (and potentially lose their place in the board view) just to understand what the sub-task belongs to.
fields.summary: Mouseover of Parent issue ID to show Summary field of Parent

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: The Agile Gadget currently determines that an issue is "Done" when it is closed. We do not close an issue until it is released tp production. So in order to determine our true burndown, we need to view "Resolved" (or greater since we have a custom workflow), whether it be configuring "Done" or showing "Closed" & "Resolved". Until this enhancement is added (or if there is a way to configure the gadget to do so) then this Gadget is useless to us.
fields.summary: Agile Gadget: Ability to Configure "Done" or show "Resolved"

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The overview of the cards has totally changed since Greenhopper 5.

But if you go back to the basics of Scrum, then we're used of using post-it notes and place them on a storyboard. Well, if you look at the colors of regular post-it notes, then you'll see that they only have 1 background color.

Let us map this into Greenhopper 5. In greenhopper 5, all the cards have 2 colors. 1 small colorish vertical bar (that you can adjust) and then the other 90% of the card has a white/gray - look. This doesn't feel right and I'm loosing oversight of my cards. You really have to put your minds to it to make really see the difference between an epic / story or a sub-task (eg: select view as summaries in planning board).

So I'm asking to make it possible to change the background color of the entire card to whatever you want it to be.

Thanks,
Sven
fields.summary: As a storycard, I want to have the possibility to have 1 general background color.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Symptom*
If user achives master release in JIRA and keeps sub release(s) unachived, Planning Board will throw NullPointerException when selecting that project.

*Cause*
com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.util.comparator.UnreleasedVersionWeightResolver can not find master release for sub release(s) in the logic of getWeight() method, then throw NullPointerException.

*Workaround*
Unachiving the relevant master version will resolve the problem.

*Resolution*
In my test, this problem can't be reproduced in GreenHopper 4.0+
fields.summary: Throw NullPointerException on Planning Board when Achive Master Release in JIRA with keeping Sub Release Unachived

fields.description:
We have multiple projects in JIRA and a few projects using the GreenHopper plug-in for agile (Scrum). The "back-log" of our projects using agile is prioritized by the the product manager, 

Can tasks coming in from other projects be prioritized in the projects using Scrum by using the Ranking feature?
fields.summary: Ranking other Projects Issues?

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Symptom:*
Under some specific scenarios, e.g. Card View includes 10+ fields or there're a long field values of Epic Issue, on Epic/Theme Popup Window the "Epic Issue" table will be extended longer, and it makes the below "Epic Stat" table squeezed out of screen. 

*Workaround*
So far, I can't find the workaround except excluding some fields from Card View.
fields.summary: Epic/Theme Popup Window may Hide a Part of Epic Stat Table

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi,

Since version 5.0, we don't have the overview of the other issues present on other pages when we move the mouse over the page number.
It was possible in previous version and very usefull. 

Is it possible to add this feature again ?
fields.summary: Display an overview of the other issues available on other pages on the task board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: The customer requires to get the exact reason that prevents the transitioning in Task Board; for example, when using the default workflow shipped with JIRA, there's a condition on "Start Progress" transition - _"Only the assignee of the issue can execute this transition."_, and when user makes the the transition from "TO DO" column to "IN PROGRESS" column, they may get the error message _"Sorry, no transitions were found! Are you meeting all the workflow step conditions? If so you might want to verify your Task Board mapping."_, but it's a little hard for them to understand the true reason except they're administrator to check workflow. They want to see the specific reason in that popup, e.g. "you should be assignee of this task to make this transitioning".
fields.summary: Improve the error message on the TB transition by providing information on what condition/validator/step is preventing the transition of a card

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We have a few columns matched up to our workflow. a simplified form is as follows (the happy path of the workflow)

Review Queue -> In Review -> Development Queue -> In Development -> Testing Queue -> In Testing -> Closed

Only items in the "Review Queue" count as "TODO" and everything up to Closed counts as "Done" even though "Development Queue" and "Testing Queue" are not "IN PROGRESS".

It would be nice to configure each queue to map it to their "work in progress" type of status.
fields.summary: Taskboard Mappings to "TODO", "IN PROGRESS" and "DONE"

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Green hopper is down and is throwing an error.
fields.summary: Green hopper is down

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
hi,

I recently migrated from 4.3 in hosted mode and users complaint about the readability of the task board and the planning board. It's mainly white on a white background and very hard to read.

Previously we had different colors per card. Now, the color is only used on the left side of the card but it's not really easy to read. 

Is it possible to have a pale version of the card color used for all the card ? 
By pale version, I mean a lighter version of the color configured for the card for the whole card and the color itself for the left side only.
fields.summary: Use color cards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In the new version of GH, the ability to configure issues per row has been removed from planning/overview board. As we where able to print cards as desired with this config, we now have been left with the not so well working "Print Cards"-feature.

The challenges with print dialog is as follows:
# Width of cards cannot be adjusted (someone want them wide, someone want them high...)
## Swithing to print on other paper size's not easy to get right, need to tamper with scaling. 
# Cards are not retained cross pages (GHS-2187)
# Cards height waste space (card rownum does not go below about 12 lines, leaving our cards with only summary, component and reporter with a lot of unused lines)
# The same configuration is used for print cards as create new cards, resulting in conflicting interests (at least for us...). We want less information on printed cards than when creating a new card.

By using summary view, planning board and the pages, this was quite easy to get right in the previous version. Now, there is no good one way to do it. 

I hope you are look into this as soon as possible, as we have 20 teams using JIRA, where they now struggle with quite bad prints...
fields.summary: Removed functionalty in new version, raise urgency of exiting problems in "Card Print"-feature

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: exception on taskboard page

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Customers are seeking the ability to have max/min notifications based on the sub-task count, in addition to the standard issue count.
fields.summary: As a GH user I would like my column constraints on the TB to provide a sub-task count

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: It will be better that the plugin has the capability to check the JIRA environment such as JIRA version whether it is compatible with the installed GreenHopper plugin version.
fields.summary: Environment Version Checking during Upgrade

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: when you click on an issue to select it, you cannot deselect it by mouse. pressing the esc key on the keyboard does though.
fields.summary: cannot deselect issue by mouse

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Can we add security to who has the ability to use the inline edit of tasks? Seem that a lot of developers are clicking on that when they go to move tasks on the taskboard.

or maybe the ability to just turn it off.
fields.summary: add security to who can perform inline editing of tasks

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: The markers do not refresh after an issue update
